results.title: Flying blind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
The “flying blind” driver is the person who is inattentive and does not seem to be aware that three seconds of “flying blind” can cause accidents. Shows examples of inattentive driving and emphasises that fatigue can cause tragedy. Recommends that a rest stop every two hours or every 100 miles for highway driving is a safety precaution which should not be ignored.
results.description:

results.title: Experience necessary
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
Takes the case of the “speed demon” behind the wheel - the man who wants to see what “she’ll” do. Points out that you need to have experience to handle a car at high speeds. Speed in itself is not dangerous, provided that the road, the traffic, the car and road conditions are right. Above all the driver needs to be careful and experienced and keep in mind at all times that speed can kill.

results.title: The Artful dodger
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
There is an artful dodger in every crowd and on every road. Demonstrates the driving style of such a person - the dodging in and out of traffic at high speed which is dangerous and can cause frayed nerves and accidents. The dodger is the person who takes unnecessary risks for no apparent reason - he is not a good safe driver. No other credits available.

results.title: Autopsy Dissection Technique
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Dissection of the heart (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Autopsy Dissection Technique”.
Shows the dissection and removal of the heart from the pericardial sac. Demonstrates in detail the opening of the various chambers, the dissection of the coronary arteries, and the examination of the various valves and their measurement. Concludes with the method of cutting and examining the myocardium.

results.title: Transmission, drive shaft and differential
results.creator_credit: Century Productions and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”
An explanation of the transmission, drive shaft and differential, indicating maintenance methods to be adopted.

results.title: Steering, wheels, front and rear axles
results.creator_credit: United States. Army. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to check for play in the steering wheel and the front end assembly; correct wheel run-out; make a test; test springs, axles and overall back-lash.

results.title: Clutch and handbrake
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to determine and correct the amount of clutch pedal clearance or “lash”, check clutch for slipping, grabbing or drag; how to inspect and adjust the hand brake.

results.title: Introduction to preventive maintenance
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
Shows the importance of preventive maintenance in truck operation and illustrates a typical preventive maintenance check as applied to the clutch pedal, the battery and the voltage regulator.
